item.title: Exposing C/C++ Data as a Python NumPy Array
item.description: I recently needed to use memory that was allocated inside a C++ library in a Python application which expects a NumPy array without performing any copies. With ctypes, this can be implemented quite easily. Let’s say we have a shared library libcpp.so where a function get_shared_memory returns the pointer to an array of doubles that is stored on the heap: cpp double* get_shared_memory(std::size_t num) { auto p = new double[num]; .
